Posts.Content: I was the same after wle told it was dcis so just radiotherapy and only tiny amount of er receptors and grade three but lymph nodes clear.went into oncol who said I needed chemo and tamoxifen. Ok I thought if its what I need but as usual studied everything on dcis-chemo not recommended. Got upset on rough days following chemo wanting to stop so phoned bc nurse she told me non invasive. Then geneticist phoned about blood tests for triple negative! Finally spoke to oncologist yesterday before chemo. Inside the tumour were invasive cells found and as its grade three need chemo. My er receptors are three so its borderline going to try tamoxifen. Feel better now I'm glad I spoke to her. I think as well because I'm a nurse I was being fobbed off but the oncol was great. Sorry for writing a book!
Posts.Title: Wrong cancer entered on my file

Posts.Content: Thanks I'm feeling better today and had a decent sleep the chemos been bearable I think it's because I've not spoken to anyone from team since start of January and not sure when I will see onc again. I'm my own worst enemy I research everything! But I will get there!!
Posts.Title: Dcis treatment

Posts.Content: Hi lindy1802 That's what has confused me no IDC. I managed to speak to nurse and she is going to arrange for me to speak to oncologist before next FEC. Unfortunately the oncologists are based 74 miles away and only visit hospital once a week. I feel better past two days as I'm sleeping and back to 'normal'. I need to stop reading everything!!
Posts.Title: Dcis treatment

Posts.Content: Seven days post second cycle of fec. Really down and confused why am I getting chemo? No lymph involvement lump was 14mm surgeon said radiotherapy but oncologist said chemo and radiotherapy. It was grade three and I'm 39. Is anyone else having treatment that's the same?
Posts.Title: Dcis treatment

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone it's interesting that a few times I've read the last one was ok. I had a reducing dose of steroids with last one and only had bone pain for twenty mins ( time for paracetamol and ibuprofen to work) I took nystatin and chlorhexidine mouthwash had lovely white tongue. That and the severe stomach cramps are the ones I'm really worried about getting again. I'm waiting for my bcn phoning back, I wonder if I could get something for those. The last time I was getting chemo when I was telling the nurse all the side effects I'd had she commented that I'd had a hard time on chemo. Myself and my mother in law were quite shocked everyone including myself all said I'd sailed thru only bad for about a week each cycle. (Until tax then two weeks) started me wondering if I've been a bit precious, but they ask about se and I tell them!
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: Well it's now a week and a day since my last chemo and I don't know what happened but it was ok. No in bed for days, up as usual, no pain, less hot flushes no abdo pain! Forced myself to drink about two litres a day and have lived off the blandest food ever mouth went but slowly coming round! Don't know if its because it was last one?? But I'm glad I did. Felt a bit weepy yesterday like I'm in limbo till I start my rads but I suppose that's ok considering. I hope everyone is ok and thanks for the replies!
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: I'm due to have my last taxotere on Wednesday and with all the side effects last time I have spoken to the breast cancer nurse and I'm not getting it now but she will get me an appointment with oncologist next Wednesday to discuss it. I'm just so confused I know it is my decision and no one can make it for me but even though I'm not getting it I don't feel any happier. at the beginning of treatment i was told the cancer was gone but because I was only 39 and grade 3 chemo was gold standard treatment, now I believe that it is going to come back in a few years time and keep coming back. but every time I think I should just have it I remember how terrible I felt. I also feel I'm being stupid and ungrateful because mine is treatable. Sorry for the length of this I am just so muddled up. I already had the reduced dose last time because I got peripheral neuropathy in mmy hands.
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: Thanks Dorothee for the reply I wish I could speak to the onc sooner but they are based 74 miles away and only come to my hospital once a week. That's what I feel like I mean I've had five what's one more then I think how I felt. I'm going to keep busy today tomorrow I'm going to get measured for my rads with luck I may be able to see the onc but doubt it. At least after today my house will be spotless!
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: Well thankfully I've came to my senses and I'm now going on Thursday for my last one so I can graduation properly! The onc wasn't sure with my hand problems but I've got the go ahead. It's only one to two weeks of the se then that's it!
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: I was on antidepressants for depression and PTSD before my diagnosis in fact I had recovered great ready to go back to work ( I'm a nurse) when I found my lump. I still take them, although missed a few with the nausea. Speak to your team and possibly GP, this is a major thing we are all going through, antidepressants could help you. I still have a few days per cycle where I feel so low but still not as bad as I felt before. I've got one more fec left then start dox not really looking forward to that. All I can say is thank god for this site and everyone on it.
Posts.Title: Feeling very Depressed on Docetaxel

Posts.Content: I'm in Scotland too. I was grade three aged 39 diagnosed nov 27th, lumpectomy on 7 & 27 th dec started chemo on jan 10th just started rads in Edinburgh staying Monday to Friday. Don't worry about time frames everything will start within the recommended time. I would stick with the nhs its the same treatment. Will you have to travel too for your rads and chemo. Where is your nearest hospital.
Posts.Title: Does anyone have advice?

Posts.Content: My hospital is about half an hour away also. Once they have a plan for you and it starts it will pass quickly, you'll get chemo more than likely because of your age and the grade. The grading only got to me during chemo, I had a wobbly moment when I'd had enough! Just thought it was unfair but I'm glad I've had all the treatment they can throw at me. My surgeon reminded me that the cancer was removed the chemo was just a precaution. X
Posts.Title: Does anyone have advice?

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone. I will get my path report so hopefully it might shed some light on it. Don't know when I'll see my onc again only in this area once a week and are based eighty miles away but I've got a list of questions ready!
Posts.Title: Finished all treatment but need advice on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Ok so after surgery, chemo and rads its now been seven weeks since everything finished. Been taking tamoxifen for five weeks and haven't had a decent nights sleep, all bloated fine monkey hair on face ( same location if you know what I mean) constant hot flushes and night sweats!! Well my dilemma is this. The onc told me my er status was three when I asked because the genetic centre that checked for brca 1&2 kept calling it triple neg. now the onc said if the se were bad I could stop. So does anyone else know their 'number' or is in the same position?
Posts.Title: Finished all treatment but need advice on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Tokes that is good to hear as we both had similar side effects! I forgot about the injections till yesterday so I'm getting my mum in law to do it which is funny cos I'm a nurse and an also a coward! Well better have some breakfast and the steroids!x
Posts.Title: Finished fec and start tax on Wednesday but feeling really nervous...

Posts.Content: I'm glad it's not just me! Sitting in my kitchen drinking coffee while having a hot flush! At least I'm thinking after this one ill no what to expect and can get what ever meds I need for the next lot and be prepared! I can't wait till I have my last one and its getting closer everyday.x
Posts.Title: Finished fec and start tax on Wednesday but feeling really nervous...

Posts.Content: Hi tokes I hope yesterday went ok. My appointment has been changed to 9am today which is handy as I've not slept ( very sensitive to steroids ) and temazepam didn't work but after today we both only have two to go so thats good! Take care.
Posts.Title: Finished fec and start tax on Wednesday but feeling really nervous...

Posts.Content: So I've finished fec which apart from one week of feeling tired/hot/occasional nausea and can't forget hair loss it's been better than I thought. But I'm having my first tax/doc on Wednesday and I'm not looking forward to it!! My hairs growing back or at least what was left now about half an inch, I've read you feel less sick but get bad muscle/nerve pain. I made the mistake of googling and some forums are all doom and gloom! I know everyone's different but it is really as bad?? X
Posts.Title: Finished fec and start tax on Wednesday but feeling really nervous...

Posts.Content: I'm in dumfries and galloway too but not starting rads till 15th may so will probably be after you. Will you be going to Edinburgh or Glasgow? I'm heading to Edinburgh for my nhs holiday! Have you been getting your chemo on a Wednesday? Long shot but I may have been in with you!!
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: I had my first tax on Wednesday at 9 am! They are lovely there and it's quite relaxing considering, I get my tattoos on the 30th. I've never heard if there are any groups in our area, I'm in touch on Facebook with a friend of a friend who went thru this two years ago it does help to talk to people going thru the same thing especially if your having a down day.
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Yes finished three fec. So far feeling ok apart from not sleeping but steroids finished now looking out for bone pain now got meds ready incase. I'm also wondering if I'm feeling better because I only have two to go. My mission is to sit in all the chairs I didn't plan it but I've had a different one each week it's now my mission!
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Chest pain can be a side effect so certain drugs I'm not sure which ones off hand ( had chemo yesterday so my brain isn't 100%). If your red blood count is low this can cause chest pain too if you get it again contact ambulance or gp for an ECG it will put your mind at rest and stop you worrying which will put your heart rate up!! Im a nurse in critical care and chest pain is best checked. But don't worry!x
Posts.Title: chest pains during and after chemo

Posts.Content: Sorry me again miss read your thread! If it during chemo they will take an ECG if theirs any concerns. Apologies for spelling chemo brain is terrible!!
Posts.Title: chest pains during and after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi everyone not been on hear to a while been finished treatment for over a year now ( surgery, fect and radiotherapy ) feels great to say that! Now here's the thing my last period was before my first chemo and haven't had one since until last night ( I was 39 then) so is this them back? It's been 19 months so I thought I was in the real menopause. Anyone else had this? X
Posts.Title: Chemopause yes or no?

Posts.Content: Thanks dorothee. Just got used to not having them then back again!
Posts.Title: Chemopause yes or no?

Posts.Content: I finished chemo and rads July this year got back to work and I thought yes I'm going to live my life now. Instead in the past twenty four hours I've lost everything. My husband is an arse when he drinks doesn't come home till he's ready. A few times this year instead of taking me out he went himself and turned off his phone cos he has fun and I'm boring. I put on two stone and got short hair tired all the time and repeatedly begged him while crying that I need help around the house, well apparently that's me putting him down! We argued last night and my youngest who's 15 said I should stop picking on his dad and get out cos I'm not his mum. I went to mine but can't talk about it all. I'm just so depressed and hate what I've become. No one had been in touch and I've got no friends to talk too. I know I should be thankful I beat this I just want everything back to normal but I know it never will be. Sorry for the rant.
Posts.Title: Alone after treatment with no one

Posts.Content: Thank you I'm just numb and confused. I need to remember I can get thru it you too will be ok it doesn't seem like it at the time but treatment does go quickly.x
Posts.Title: Alone after treatment with no one
